intro: Keckia rothrockii, commonly known as the Rothrock's keckia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, while its flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Keckia rothrockii is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
